item.description: Update Traffic - Physical Rescue; INC#0342; 08:18AM; 100 E 111th Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vMiMQK; Broadway-Manchester; Two car collision with a total of four patients, all of which have been extricated. Three pediatric patients: 18 mos, 13 yo, 16 yo (genders unknown) and a 35 yo female. All are in *at least* critical condition with at least one of the pediatric patients in grave condition. The vehicles made contact with a building which has no structural integrity issues. Any questions regarding the collision are referred to LAPD Inc# 0893. No further updates anticipated.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC11 E233 E33 E57 E64 E65 E79 EM1 EM11 EM13 HR3 RA246 RA257 RA264 RA33 RA65 T33 T64; CH7; 14; Margaret Stewart

Traffic - Physical Rescue; INC#0342; 07:56AM; 100 E 111th Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vMiMQK; Broadway-Manchester; Traffic collision with initial reports of four patients in critical condition. Two patients have been removed from the vehicle and firefighters are working to extricate the remaining two. Age/gender of the patient is unknown at this time. Additional resources requested. LAPD Inc# 0893; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC11 E33 E57 E64 EM13 HR3 RA264 RA65 T64; CH7; 14; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#0169; 07:44AM; Nb 110 Tr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GRs3xt; Downtown; The propane tank was disconnected from the tractor and the tank was safely up righted onto its tires. The experts are still evaluating whether the propane needs to be off-loaded prior to reattaching and moving the tank. The tractor is still on its side. ; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 CM20 CM22 E21 E215 E221 E294 E94 EM11 HM94 JT1 JT6 PI1 RA15 RA815 SQ21 T15 T21 T94; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#0169; 05:41AM; Nb 110 Tr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GRs3xt; Downtown; LAFD HazMat Squad confirmed there are no propane leaks at this time. There is slight damage to the tank. The only leak was of engine oil which has been diked and prevented from spreading. There are no signs of fuel leaking. The normal operation for this type of incident involves the off-loading of the load into an empty tanker prior to the overturned vehicle being moved upright. The tanker company has an empty truck enroute and the next step actions are being evaluated. This is a static situation and firefighters have protection lines (charged handlines) in place as standard precaution. This will significantly impact the morning commute and drivers are advised to follow CHP alerts and traffic updates for alternate routes. CHP Log# 295; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 CM20 CM22 E21 E215 E221 E294 E94 EM11 HM94 JT1 JT6 PI1 RA15 RA815 SQ21 T15 T21 T94; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Hazardous Materials; INC#0169; 04:30AM; Nb 110 Tr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GRs3xt; Downtown; NB 110 transition to the EB 10 FWY: Propane tanker trailer with a full load (estimated 9000 gal) on its side. The driver is safely out of the vehicle. Initial reports of no leaks at this time. This will be an extended duration operation and commuters are advised to seek alternate routes. CHP Log # 295; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 CM20 CM22 E21 E215 E221 E294 E94 EM11 RA15 RA815 SQ21 T15 T21 T94; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

title.a: Hiker Rescue - Interagency Hoist Op 01/08/2023 INC#1009

item.description: Hiker Rescue - Interagency Hoist Op; INC#1009; 04:22PM; 2100 Queensferry Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Zo7waI; Brentwood; Firefighter / Paramedics made their way to an adult male patient who is stable but in serious condition and unable to walk (non-traumatic medical complaint). The terrain/location is not conducive to a safe ground based rescue. LAFD Air Ops was in the process of a hoist/transport of an injured hiker on a separate incident therefore a LA Co Sheriff helicopter was requested. LASD Air 5 is closer than the LAFD hoist helicopter and will conduct the hoist operation supported by LAFD firefighters on the ground and LAFD command helicopter. The 9-1-1 call was received at 3:38PM. No further details.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 BP19 E19 E269 H2 H3 HA2 HA3 RA19 RA69 RH214 T69; CH7; 15; Margaret Stewart

Hiker Rescue - Hoist Op; INC#0953; 03:28PM; 2898 E Observatory Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GRsXtS; Griffith Park; LAFD Air Ops lowered a medic to meet the ground firefighters and assess a 20yo male patient with traumatic injuries sustained in a fall. Due to the injuries and terrain, LAFD Air Ops will conduct a hoist operation and transport the patient. The 9-1-1 call was received at 3:03PM. No further details.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC5 E203 E227 E235 E27 E35 H3 H5 HA3 HA5 HR3 RA27 RA3 RA56 RA803 RA827 RA835 RA844 RH114 T27 T3 T35 UR27 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1237; 06:29PM; 529 W 107th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Zhi6QW; #VermontVista; Twenty-four firefighters quickly responded, located and extinguished the flames inside the one-story home in 15 minutes. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E233 E264 E64 E65 RA257 RA64 SQ21 T33 T64; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1237; 06:14PM; 529 W 107th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Zhi6QW; #VermontVista; One-story single family home with moderate smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E233 E264 E64 E65 RA64 SQ21 T33 T64; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0824; 02:09PM; 682 W 13th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GsxKAr; #SanPedro; Twenty firefighters performed a well-coordinated attack on a vacant bungalow to quickly extinguish the flames in 9 minutes, keeping the fire contained to the unit of origin and protecting neighboring structures. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 48; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC706 E112 E248 E48 RA112 RA848 T48; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange
